title: 107_hr3919
content: The "Pension Interest Rate Relief Act of 2002" sets an interest rate range for additional funding requirements. The Pension Interest Rate Relief Act of 2002 amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a special rule for plan years 2001-2004 regarding interest rates for determining current liability. The Pension Interest Rate Relief Act of 2002 provides a special rule for plan years 2001-2004 regarding interest rates for determining current liability. For plan years beginning in 2005, a special rule allows for a maximum interest rate of 120 percent of the weighted average, and a redetermination of current liability using 105 percent as the specified percentage. The Pension Interest Rate Relief Act of 2002 includes a special rule for plan years 2001-2004, allowing for a redetermination of current liability using 105 percent as the specified percentage. Amendments to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 also address interest rates for determining current liability. The Pension Interest Rate Relief Act of 2002 allows for a special rule for plan years 2001-2004, permitting a redetermination of current liability with an interest rate not exceeding 120 percent of the weighted average. Amendments to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 also address interest rates for determining current liability. For plan years 2005, the current liability shall be redetermined using 105 percent as the specified percentage. Amendments to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 address interest rates for determining current liability. Amendments to the Retirement Protection Act of 1994 include making a transition rule permanent and implementing special rules for certain purposes. The funded current liability percentage for different purposes under the Internal Revenue Code and the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 are specified to be not less than 90% or 100%. The mortality table used for determining unfunded vested benefits is also defined. The amendments made by this subsection regarding the mortality table used by the plan will apply to plan years starting after December 31, 2001.
